qna.a: Fulltime N T U undergraduates who are admitted into triple E are automatically members of the triple E club. The club is a constituent body of the N T U students’ union, which caters for students’ welfare. The club organizes a variety of events to suit the different needs of our active students. They also organize leisure events like cruise dinners, movie screenings and holiday getaways at subsidised rates. In addition, they co‐organize events like bowling rendezvous and graduates’ evening with the triple E alumni to encourage interaction and networking between undergraduates and alumni members. The club also serves as a bridge between the school and the students.

alt.ssml: <speak>Fulltime <say-as interpret-as="spell-out">NTU</say-as> undergraduates who are admitted into triple E are automatically members of the triple E club. The club is a constituent body of the <say-as interpret-as="spell-out">NTU</say-as> students’ union, which caters for students’ welfare. The club organizes a variety of events to suit the different needs of our active students. They also organize leisure events like cruise dinners, movie screenings and holiday getaways at subsidised rates. In addition, they co‐organize events like bowling rendezvous and graduates’ evening with the triple E alumni to encourage interaction and networking between undergraduates and alumni members. The club also serves as a bridge between the school and the students.</speak>

q: What is triple E club
What does triple E club do
How does triple E club work
What is EEE club

qna.a: Counseling refers to an interactive learning process of addressing students’ intimate concerns, issues or behaviours facilitated by a professionally trained counselor within a private and confidential setting. If the personal issues or challenges you are facing are affecting your quality of life in the areas of your health, relationship, daily activities, academic performance or eating and sleeping patterns, it is recommended that you seek professional counseling.

qna.a: All matriculated full time undergraduate, who have paid the student health service fee, are eligible for the medical scheme. This fee is collected through the student bill. It operates from 8:30am 9pm from monday to friday, and 9am to 12 noon on saturday.

qna.a: The eight N T U libraries on campus provide space, resources and services to support learning and research. They are arts, design and media Library, business library, Chinese library, communication and information library, humanities and social sciences library, Lee Wee Nam library, library outpost, and Wang Gung Wu Library. There is a range of library materials that cater to various learning needs and preferences. The print collection stands at more than half a million books now and is growing about 40000 volumes per year. There is also a good selection of audio visual materials, numbering about 26000 items. N T U community is also endowed with the rich collection of N I E Library and information services centre, which provides a strong collection in education, humanities and science.

alt.ssml: <speak>The eight <say-as interpret-as="spell-out">NTU</say-as> libraries on campus provide space, resources and services to support learning and research. There is also a good selection of audio visual materials, numbering about 26000 items. <say-as interpret-as="spell-out">NTU</say-as> community is also endowed with the rich collection of <say-as interpret-as="spell-out">NIE</say-as> Library and information services centre, which provides a strong collection in education, humanities and science.</speak>

qna.a: You can participate in numerous sporting activities at the N T U sports centre. The NTU sports centre is well equipped with a swimming pool, badminton, squash, basketball, and volleyball courts and soccer fields, among other things. There are also religious, cultural, academic and sports societies in NTU for students’ participation. Many of these activities held throughout the year are displayed by banners in the university canteens.

qna.a: Applications from local and international students are to be made online after acceptance of the offer of admission to N T U. Students who are offered admission after the application deadline will be given a hardcopy application form in their admission package. New students are guaranteed admission when they apply by the closing date for hall applications and are randomly assigned a room in a hall. Senior students who need to apply for halls are required to satisfy campus life involvement criterion by earning E C A points. For more information on this, you may refer to: tinyurl.com/y8b49pnb

New students are guaranteed admission when they apply by the closing date for hall applications and are randomly assigned a room in a hall. qna.a: The alumni was set up in december 1996 by our triple E graduates and its main objectives are to organise educational, social, cultural, recreational, sporting and civic activities among alumni triple E members. It is a great networking channel for N T U triple E graduates. This association also serves as a body for members in the promotion and advancement of electrical and electronic engineering education and knowledge. It also promotes closer interaction between the association, industry and other alumni associations.

qna.a: When you are researching a partner university, you need to know if the courses there have equivalent courses or matches in N T U, such that you can transfer credits back to N T U after your exchange. It is best to select universities where there are at least 15 to 20 courses you can take. You may submit your 10 course preferences in the course matching system on the student link for your N T U school exchange coordinator to approve.

qna.a: A degree audit is an record that enables the student and his academic counselor to assess the student's academic progress and unfulfilled degree requirements and other requirement. The audit is a tool for academic planning and course selection. A transcript is a record of the courses taken and grades earned of a student throughout a program.

qna.a: The academic unit is a measure of the students’ workload associated with both class attendance and preparation. Under the academic unit system, each course is assigned a certain number of academic units. The associate chair will discuss the A U distribution during the orientation day program.

qna.a: The computer room in the school of triple E is named triple E i hub. It is located at S2.2‐B4‐05. The opening hours are from 8.30am to 11.00pm, mondays to fridays, during term time and from 8.30am to 5.30pm, mondays to fridays, during vacation period. Students may surf the internet and print lecture notes or other materials in triple E i hub. Alternatively, students may purchase photocopied lecture notes in the photocopy room located at S2.2‐B4‐01. Two self‐service photocopy machines are available in the photocopy room. Students may request assistance for bulk photocopy.

qna.a: The dean's list is compiled on a yearly basis. The top 5% of the cohort, subject to attaining a minimum Y G P A of 4.50 and the specified A U of graded courses by curriculum type taken in N T U in the academic year, is eligible for the dean's list. Full-time single degree students have to complete at least 15 A U of graded courses. Courses that are graded as satisfactory or unsatisfactory and pass or fail or those with grades exempted and leave of absence are not counted in the A U of graded courses for the purpose of determining the dean's list. Besides this, final year students must attain at least a second upper honours or honours degree in order to be considered for the dean's list.

qna.a: Use the Content Designer test tool to test a question, and check what items are returned, ranked in order of score. If the desired item does not have the highest score, then add the question to the item and run the test again. The desired item should now have the highest score. Take care not to create items with duplicate questions, to avoid unpredictable responses.

qna.a: Students must apply for short leave of absence or medical leave with the undergraduate programme office, if they cannot attend classes on the following occasions: On days when there are laboratory sessions. On days when quizzes or tests are conducted during classes. On any other occasions that tutor or lecturer deemed as compulsory for students' attendance. Compassionate leave will be granted in the event of the demise of an immediate family member. Normally absence from School within 7 days of the event and on the day of the funeral is accepted as valid leave of absence on compassionate ground. Categories of leave not approved: Returning to home country during festive period. Participating in activities organized by student bodies during the various occasions mentioned in the point above.

How do I apply for leave of absence

qna.a: The undergraduate research experience on campus, or eureka, has been established to promote research culture among able students. Eureka is eligible only to second and third year undergraduates who have excelled in their examinations, so it is by invitation only.

qna.a: All full time students who have missed classes due to illness must send the original medical certificate to the triple E undergraduate programme office no later than 7 working days after their medical leave. Students who missed any quiz or lab sessions on the grounds of medical leave would be allowed to do a makeup for the missed session, unless stated otherwise by the tutors. Students are also advised not to give their original M C to the respective tutors. The medical certificate submission form is available at the undergraduate programme office.
